name: Dutch Apple Cake
author: Carol
summary: This is another great cake for the fall.  When apples are plentiful and delicious there are so many ways to thank mother nature for its bounty.  I pick a lot of the wild apples in the fall, and turn them into great desserts.
ingredients: 2  apples - peeled, cored and cut into eighths
directions: Sift flour with baking powder and salt
In a large bowl, cream shortening and 1 cup sugar until light
Beat in egg and vanilla until fluffy
Add sifted ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with the sifted ingredients
Spread the batter into a greased 7 x 11 inch baking pan
Place apple pieces in rows on the batter with the sharp edges pressed in slightly
Sprinkle 1/4 cup sugar and cinnamon on top
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 50 to 60 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the cake tests done
